text: The Pointer, sometimes called the English Pointer, is a medium-sized breed of pointing dog developed in England. Pointers are used to find game birds for hunters. Unlike other hunting dogs, such as Spaniels, they do not collect the birds that have been shot but they point out to the hunter where the live bird is hiding. ==History== The most common belief is that the dogs like this breed were imported into England in 1719 by soldiers returning from Spain after a war and bred with local hunting dogs. == Description == This dog is a medium sized hunting dog that wieighs between and stands between . Its is most commonly coloured brown and white, black and white, orange and white or lemon and white with speckles on the white fur. ==Health and temperment== The Pointer is usually a healthy dog with a kind nature, they need a lot of excercise. ==References== Category:Dog breeds originating in the United Kingdom Category:FCI breeds
title: English Pointer
